review_blob: This beer is possibly my best of 2010. Very good hop notes for a black IPA. Great balance with a surprising mix of tastes. I wish this was available on the east coast.

What can you add to whats already been said about this beer? Among the top 5 beers Ive ever had. Very good balance between bitter hops and sweet malt. Actually a bit sweeter and maltier than I expected but great nonetheless.

This beer comes wth such a bitter reputation...yes its btter but it is to its credit. Its a bitter that keeps you wanting more, a bitter that is definately not a negative. Its a very complex beer that changes the game in Imperial IPAs. Definately a pleasant surprise.
An incredibly balanced beer - plenty of hops and a complimentary maltiness for this, my current favorite. Its a bit pricey though.
Great summer beer - a ligher and very hoppy wheat beer. Disadvantage, it is only sold in the midwest - Illinois, Indiana, Wisconsin.
The best first impression of this beer is the dark color, hinting at the great malty balance to the abundant hops. Overall, a great beer.
